markdown.markdown: Welcome to the website for BAN430 Forecasting. We will use this website as a supplement to lectures. The website is an ongoing development, so not all subjects will have content yet. Below you will find a detailed (preliminary) lecture plan, link to the textbook and curriculum. ## Lecture plan ```{r lecturePlan, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE} library(tidyverse) options(knitr.kable.NA = '') library(dplyr) library(kableExtra) readxl::read_excel("lecturePlan.xlsx", sheet = "Sheet3", col_types= rep("text",3))[,-1] %>% kbl() %>% kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("condensed", "hover"), fixed_thead = T) %>% row_spec(seq(1,25,2) , background = "#2E8B5750") %>% row_spec(28, bold = T, background = "DarkRed", color = "white") ``` ## Literature We will use the textbook *Forecasting: Principles and Practice*, 3rd edition, by Hyndman and Athanasopoulos, i.e. the online version which can be accessed at . ## Curriculum Textbook Hyndman and Athanasopoulos(2021) chapters 1-10 and 13. Additional notes by lecturer on volatility forecasting. All the material on this website.
